intro: Mesodetra, commonly known as the false heather, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It consists of several species that are native to various regions of the Americas. These plants typically have small, clustered flowers and are often found in moist, acidic soils. The leaves are usually evergreen and needle-like, contributing to their ornamental appeal. Mesodetra species are valued in horticulture for their ability to thrive in shaded environments.
